It had been a long and grueling night. After a lengthy mission had ended with a brutal battle which ended in their favor, both Naruto and Kiba were absolutely bushed. Too tired to return home, Kiba opted to spend the night while Naruto was simply too exhausted to care. Having returned to Naruto's apartment, the two had practically passed out upon arrival. Kiba plopped face first onto the couch and broke into snoring almost immediately, while Naruto tossed his jacket and tanktop aside to sleep comfortably yet exhausted atop his own bed, sleeping almost immediately as his cool mattress met with his bare and strained upper torso.

Some hours had passed while both teens were dead asleep. Suddenly, Naruto winced in his sleep a few times, before eventually waking up, sitting up in his bed and groaning in discomfort. A sudden and acidic sounding gurgling emanated from Naruto's washboard abs, causing him in wince in pain as he clutched his bare stomach firmly with one hand. "Rgh...what the hell...?" was all Naruto could mutter over his gurgling stomach. The gurgling emanating from Naruto's stomach grew louder, causing him even more pain as he gritted his teeth, clutching his gut firmly. Doing his best to maintain composure, Naruto rubbed his stomach gently in an effort to coax the pain away, but it proved futile.

Getting up, the shirtless blond proceeded to walk into the kitchen to find anything that would put his troubled, still gurgling belly at ease. As Naruto walked into the kitchen, he saw Kiba without his jacket on, snoring face first against the couch all slouched like that of a child. The dog-nin looked utterly ridiculous, but still, Naruto couldn't help but smirk a bit at the sight as he poured himself a glass of milk.

Unfortunately, Naruto overestimated how loud Kiba was snoring compared to how loud his stomach's gurgling had become. Suddenly, Kiba's snoring ceased, and instead, a muffled mumbling could be heard from the couch, as Kiba slowly lifted his head, still slouched, barely conscious, and asked, "Mmph...what the hell is that noise....?" he asked, face still partially planted against the cushion. Blushing a bit, Naruto rubbed the back of his blond head sheepishly and said, "That'd be my stomach..." Kiba stared blankly for a moment, half annoyed from being woken, half confused by the answer.
"...Your stomach?" asked Kiba, earning a less than earnest nod from Naruto. "Why the hell is your stomach making that much noise...?"
"I dunno honestly. I think maybe all that Ichiraku's we had before that mission didn't sit right after that fight. Probably should'a waited til after-"

Naruto stopped mid sentence, as his stomach gurgled funny, causing a rush of air to rise up his throat. Pressing his hand firmly against his belly, Naruto immediately pushed out a massively loud and lengthy belch, which carried on for almost five seconds straight as it blasted the airwaves of his kitchen and living room.

When it was over, Kiba sat there wide eyed for a moment while Naruto smacked his lips and patted his bare stomach proudly. "Wow, that actually....wasn't half bad..." responded Kiba, admittedly impressed despite the annoyance of his now being awake. "Yeah. Wonder what brought THAT on..." noted Naruto.

My belly doesn't hurt anywhere near as much anymore as it did a few seconds ago!" Naruto noted happily. "Maybe I just got indigestion or something."
"Then I guess keep burping the gas outta your gut until you feel better...or at least until your stomach stops making so much damn noise..." Kiba noted in annoyance, causing the young blond to smirk apologetically. Still it wasn't a bad idea, and considering how much pride Naruto always took in his burping skills, it'd at least be an entertaining way to coax his bellyache.

So, Naruto gulped down some air, causing his abs to bloat outward just slightly from the air being deposited into his belly, then pounded his chiseled chest, forcing out yet another bassy belch in the process. 1553322222222211121111.content:
The sun set down over the peaceful mountain village as three weary travelers slowly passed through on their way to their next guild mission. Those travelers were none other than Lucy, Happy the flying cat, and of course; fire mage Natsu Dragneel. The objective: to put a stop to a series of attacks led by a renegade Earth Mage known only as "Tremor". The reward? Two Hundred Thousand Jewels. The three barely managed to carry themselves through town, when suddenly a loud rumble caused a strife of panic in both Lucy and Happy. "Oh no, did you hear that rumbling?! It's Tremor! It's gotta be!" stuttered a panicked Lucy as she glanced left and right in search of the mad mage. "B-b-but where is he?! Natsu, do you see him?! Natsu?!!?" She immediately turned, only to find the source of the rumbling was none other than Natsu's stomach, as it let another starving rumble. Natsu clutched his abs in pain and whimpered like a child, "Ugh, I'm sooooooooo hungry! Can't we just grab a bite to eat? Tremor can wait, but I'm not so sure my stomach can..." said a hungry Natsu as both Lucy and Happy simply stared as an embarrassed sweat drop rolled over both their not-so-surprised faces.

"....You've gotta be kidding me...." said Lucy.
"No, I'm pretty sure he's being serious, Lucy," responded an obvious Happy, causing Lucy to face palm immediately and say, "you don't say..."

She then turned to Natsu and said, "Can't you just wait until AFTER Tremor's been dealt with? I mean I don't know about you two, but I'd prefer we actually get PAID before we stuff ourselves like pigs."
"...And you'd rather we stop Tremor before he can hurt anyone else....right?"
"Huh? Oh yeah, that too. Whatever."
Whimpering, Natsu turned to Lucy and said, "Come on, Lucy, we've been on traveling for hours. And unless you can find a bonfire anywhere, I need to get something in my belly if I'm gonna take this rockbrain on!" Lucy sighed submissively. "Ugh, fine. But just a quick bite, we can't really expect to beat Tremor if you're too busy stuffing your-" like dust in the wind, Natsu had Road Runner'd his way to the nearest restaurant before Lucy could finish her warning. She simply stared in awe for a moment, before finishing with "....self..." and joining Natsu.

Upon arrival, she immediately found Natsu at a table with several plates in front of him, a good number of which were already bone dry, much to her shock as Natsu rapidly gorged himself on various meats and vegetables. "Your appetite never ceases to amaze me, Natsu," said an astonished Lucy as she was too enthralled by the sight of Natsu shoving various plates of food down his throat like a madman. Happy helped himself to a nearby fish Natsu hadn't touched and chewed almost as vigorously as his friend. "Mmmm, *GULP* so good! *MUNCH* Lucy! You gotta try the roast beef!" Said Natsu as he gulped down a heaping mouthful into his gullet and promptly went to work on another plate. "Uhhh, n-no, I'm fine, thanks..."

After some time had passed, all the plates had been reduced to a massive crumb covered pile as Natsu leaned back and rubbed his bare stomach satisfied with his meal. "Ahhh, now THAT hit the spot," said a full Natsu with a blissful smile across his face. "H-how can you possibly eat so much and not put on a pound...?" asked an astonished Lucy. Natsu blinked then shrugged before explaining, "I dunno. Maybe the fire in my belly just burns it all up super quick?" Before he could struggle with an answer, a familiar gurgling emanated from the fire mage's six pack abs, causing a curious stare from Lucy. "Wha-? Y-you're not seriously hungry after all that, are you?!" But it wasn't hunger rumbling from Natsu's gullet, but rather his fiery digestive process, which worked a large air bubble up Natsu's throat which he promptly expelled from his mouth.

*BBBBBBRRRRRRRRRRRRRRUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUAAAAAAAAAARRRRRRRRRPPPPP!*

Lucy's eyes widened as Natsu released a large and noisy belch right in the restaurant, earning several startled and disgusted stares from patrons dining alongside them. Upon its' end, Natsu smacked his lips and laughed, "Whew, hehe! What was a big one or what?" he said playfully as he patted his stomach in satisfaction. "Uhhh, Natsu?"

Natsu then glanced back at a disgusted and mortified Lucy, then slowly turned his eyes to everyone else in the restaurant, only to find a number of other faces equally as horrified as Lucy, all staring blankly at him. Natsu then flushed with embarrassment. "Uhh....eheh...excuse me...?" Nothing. After a brief moment of silence, Natsu cleared his throat and held his hand up. "Ummm, c-check please?"

The three paid up and promptly left the restaurant. "You. Pig." said an irritated Lucy. "Huh?" responded an all too oblivious Natsu. "Oh come on, it's not a big deal. Everyone burps! Me, Gray, Gajeel, Happy here. Heck, even you!"
"Yes, but never in public, or in the middle of a restaurant full of people we're trying to save from a crazed Earth mage!"
"Ah whatever. Let's go find this dude and get paid!"

The Guild was off on a mission, leaving only Dragonslayer Natsu Dragneel and Ice Mage Gray Fullbuster behind at the Guild HQ. With neither one all that good with talking, least of all with each other, the two just stood around basking in awkward silence for several minutes. "Soooooo," began Natsu, "...you wanna....do anything?"

Before the half naked Ice Mage could respond, a loud gurgling emanated throughout the guild. Looking down, Gray blushed profusely upon realizing the source was his chiseled stomach. Smiling sheepishly, he rubbed the back of his head innocently, and said, "Weeeeell, I can think of ONE thing..." Natsu was about to laugh at his face, when a familiar noise sounded off from his own stomach. Clutching at it, embarrassed, Natsu scoffed then said, "Heh, well, I GUESS we could have a quick bite..."

Both young men entered the kitchen and glanced around in search of something to eat. Sure enough, what awaited them both on entry was a buffet laden table, with all sorts of meats, fruits, snacks and drinks stacked atop, just begging to be consumed. Both boys simply stared in awe at what could only be described as the greatest meal waiting to happen. Shaking his head from this trance, Gray looked back at Natsu, conflicted. "Wait, what are we doing? We can't eat all this!"
"Why the Hell not, Blizzard Breath?"
"First off, because it's for everyone in the Guild, not just us! Secondly, because-"

His stomach groaned in protest, cutting him off his train of thought. Glancing back down, he stared for a moment, then back at the table smothered in food, then flat out said, "On second thought, let's dig in!"

And that's exactly what both boys did. Like animals who hadn't eaten in days, both Natsu and Gray tore into the food and stuffed their faces at record breaking speeds. "Mmmmm, *gulp!* *gulp* *sluuuuurrrrp!* oh it's all so good!" said Natsu between bites. Gray, mouth full of assorted meats, took a huge gulp, which sent a massive bulge traveling from his cheeks down through his throat and eventually disappearing into his stomach. He then sighed heartily and nodded in agreement, before instantly inhaling more food.

After some time had passed, the once food laden buffer was nothing but a stack of crumb ridden plates.

It was mid-afternoon on Sunday in Inaba and Chie, Yosuke, Yukiko, Rise, Kanji and Naoto sat around a table in Junes, chatting. The mood was even cheerier than usual, because Yu would be returning to Inaba next week, and they'd all get to see him again. The group was talking to each other as Yosuke partook in his favourite pastime, teasing Chie. This time, it was about how big the steak on her plate was.

"Heh, Chie, That's a pretty big steak ya got there! You quite sure you can eat all that?"

"Shut up, Yosuke! You know how I am with steak! I could eat your whole menu if I wanted to!"

Yosuke smirked at that comment.

"You sure about that?"

"Huh? What do you mean?"

"I challenge you to that! Go on. Eat everything on the Junes menu! I dare you!"

"Oh yeah? Well what happens in the results?"

"If I win, you pay for your own meal and, if you win, I'll pay for your meal and get you all 75% discounts for the next month."

Kanji's eyes lit up.

"75%? Are you serious?

Yosuke nodded.

"Deadly serious. So, Chie, can you eat the entire Junes menu?"

Rise looked to Chie

"C'mon, Chie, you gotta! 75% discounts for a whole month?! Do you know how much we could save?"

Naoto turned her head to Chie, her expression sceptical.

"Chie, you shouldn't do this. The Junes menu isn't exactly small, and eating so much would only result in you getting fa-"

However, Rise interrupted Naoto's logical warning.

"C'mon, Chie! We're counting on you!

At this moment, Chie's stomach growled deafeningly and Yosuke chuckled.

"May I take that as a yes, miss Satonaka?"

Chie looked to the rest of the group.

"Fine, but only because I'm hungry. And If I do any gross stuff, then remember that you all wanted this!"

Chie signalled a waitress over to their table and spoke.

"Um, excuse me? Could I get one of everything, please?

The waitress was taken aback. Nobody had ordered everything before!

"E-Everything?"

"Yeah, everything. Every last thing on that menu of yours."

"Y-Yes m-ma'm!"

15533222222222222222222222211211.content:
Alone, within the living-room of the Dan, Seto was relaxing. The rest of the Dan was gone to do some random stuff, sometimes in groups, sometimes alone. He had decided to stay alone, just to enjoy his time. As friendly as he could be, he sometimes did need some time alone.

He was picking up some magazines and reading them. Aah, again- Momo Kisaragi on the cover. She was popular, wasn't she? After all, her Captivating Eyes made the trick, but he was reassured now everyone could be happy. He couldn't remember well what exactly happened a few days back, but from Shintaro's explanation, this sounded pretty bad. But at least, everyone was reunited and happy, they could finally get a relatively normal-ish, life, save for the occasional oddities which are caused by their eyes-

Or can they? Seto wasn't really sure, but his mind was free of worries right now. He was even lightly humming a song while turning the pages of the magazine, often falling on some bizarre news or some without any interest. After all, this was a tabloid- Nothing much of interest in things like that.

He then let go of the magazine and stood up, stretching himself. Staying sitting for too long wasn't a good idea. So he decided to use his legs by walking around, until he eventually headed to the bathroom to check on how he looked today, much more out of curiosity than narcissism, even if he was quite confident on his looks.

But soon, something caught the black-haired boy's sight. Something he didn't expect to see. That's only after noticing it he felt it, but his hands went down to his trim waistline-

Well, previously trim. His stomach looked rather rounded and pressing a bit against his strangely-stylized hoodie. He rose an eyebrow but did not appear too panicked. This was probably due to Marry's tea which was so delicious he could only consume litres and litres of it without breaking a sweat. But for some reason, upon pressing it, sloshing did not occur. Rather, it felt... Firm. And hard. Like if a gas was filling him...

He decided to shrug it off. Maybe something he ate didn't agree with the young man's body, as he turned around and headed back to the living room, but then, silence was slowly replaced by a hiss. His eyes widened slightly and he looked around, only to realize the sound was coming from himself. Looking down, he finally noticed his stomach was bulging out like a balloon! He got a good hold on it and felt how the texture had grown to something similar of an air-filled balloon. His eyes widened further as he mumbled: "W-Well... T-This is new...!" While cracking a twisted smile which came out from the need to try and calm down his fear which was growing at the same rate as his gut.

He stepped back until he eventually tripped on his feet and fell on the couch. He kept on massaging his bulging section which was starting to tighten his hoodie a good deal. He would remove it, but all of his thoughts were focused on the growing frame, which made him look rather unnaturally bloated now. Seto was scared, but he found weird enjoyment in running his hands on the swelling stomach.

The door though, unlocked a few seconds after, and Seto was still swelling. He let out a gasp. He couldn't show himself like this to anyone! He tried to run and hide, but this was too late, so he silently accepted his fate while still expanding like a balloon.

From the opened door was revealed...

1553322222222222222222222221122222211.content:
...Or what Kenjirou planned anyways.

He was testing dangerous chemicals. He had decided to head for much, much wilder experiments than what he was usually doing. He had decided to go a step further in his researcher business, thing he was along with being a teacher. If he went a step further, perhaps he could begin getting recognition, in his field. He was tired of being just seen as a simple teacher for special needs class, along with teaching an idol who was constantly overbooked by her concerts and the like.

He wasn't sure what these chemicals did. But after thorough researching on the components, the organization of the atoms and their energy levels, he finally came to a conclusion that these two, bizarre chemicals, would create something extraordinary.

Three milliliters of that... Six of something else...

Dilute with water... Not forgetting to throw in some acid so...

And now for the little final touch, some of this...

"Now all should be ready. The reaction should occur, if there's any." The middle-aged man declared, placing the graduated flask he had prepared aside. He wasn't sure how or when the reaction happened. Whatever, he was mostly ready for the eventualities. His lab coat was closed, he was wearing protection glasses on top of his usual vision ones, and as well as some gloves, since some of the components he used were highly corrosive.

He waited a few minutes. 10 minutes spent, and nothing yet seemed to happen. Perhaps this was useless, he thought, but that was what experiments were made for anyways, right? As he removed his labcoat, protection glasses and gloves, though, he began smelling something pleasant. He couldn't describe it, but it had a certain smell close to a strawberry. He kept on smelling the strange vapor. Where did it exactly come from?

He looked around, and moved a few steps here and there, trying to spot the source, though he quickly remembered the solution. What if it came from there? The smell was tantalizing and he couldn't help but grow more and more attracted by the wondrous scent. Had he created a new kind of perfume? He took another powerful smell. It had a very strong, fruity smell. This could definitely be a nice perfume!

For some reason, after taking such a long smell, he let out a large belch, which he was quick to hush, and despite there being nobody around, he couldn't help but blush. How weird of him to belch in a moment like this. Though, the more he smelled the gas, the more cramped his stomach felt. He placed a hand on his stomach, and it felt hard and firm. He let out a shy groan as he leaned against the wall and rubbed his still-flat paunch, though soon enough, he could feel it pressing gently against his hand. Kenjirou looked down: He was beginning to inflate!

Now he knew what other effect the product had, and was sure he would definitely not use it as a perfume at all. He tried to spot for windows to open, but nothing. So, as a last resort, he tried to open the door, but it was locked by god-knows-what. The slightly bulging scientist looked back at the solution, then down at his rather bloated stomach, still rubbing it carefully. It began to press against the buttons of his red shirt, and a little against the belt holding his pants. Overall, Kenjirou was looking like he ate a little too much. In the case of a balloon, it looked nicely filled - That was it, Kenjirou was slowly inflating like a balloon.

The rounding scientist had no choice but to accept what was going on. He leaned against the wall and rubbed his swollen belly as the strawberry scent kept on getting to his nostrils. He'd try to breathe by the mouth, but the outcome would be exactly the same. He could hear little groans, hisses and creaks coming from his stomach and clothing, watching as the belly rounded out a little further, applying more stress to the buttons of his shirt. Tightening marks began appearing on the sides to show it began to be quite a bit strained, and he tried to adjust his growing uncomfortable belt, to no avail. But overall, it didn't feel too nice - the smell seemed to give him some sort of bizarre enjoyment regarding the situation. He gave on some more belches, as a sort of pressure reliever, although his paunch did not deflate.

The bloated man kept on expanding as time went on...
